Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the DIO erred in refusing Xungong Tong's permanent residence application under the skilled worker category
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act and Regulations
Crimes.Application_Facts: Tong scored 48 out of 67 required points; disputes over education (15/20), adaptability (0/5), and arranged employment (0/10)
Crimes.Court_Ruling: DIO's decision was correct and reasonable
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Applicant for permanent residence under skilled worker category
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: DIO refused application based on point assessment and regulatory compliance
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged procedural unfairness and misinterpretation of regulations
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: No breach of procedural fairness found
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Unclear or insufficient evidence provided by applicant
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Documentation related to education, employment, and adaptability
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Skilled worker point assessment criteria under IRPA
Crimes.Application_Basis: Permanent residence under skilled worker category
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Educational credentials, job offer, work history, language test results
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Minimum 67-point threshold for skilled worker eligibility
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Insufficient proof of education, lack of permanent job offer, unauthorized work affecting adaptability
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: No demonstrable harm due to lawful decision-making process
Crimes.Cause_Description: Application lacked sufficient points due to unclear evidence and failure to meet regulatory requirements
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: DIO assessed submitted documents and found them inadequate
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: Failure to meet point-based requirements under IRPA
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Not applicable – application denied prior to residency grant
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Section of IRPA governing skilled worker applications
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: DIO conducted proper evaluation under regulatory framework
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Applicant did not meet minimum eligibility criteria
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of verifiable evidence for key factors

Crimes.Violation_Type: Unauthorized Work and Ineligible Skilled Worker Application
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the DIO erred in denying points for adaptability, arranged employment, and education
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act and Regulations
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant is a Buddhist monk; lacked documentation for education, no permanent job offer, worked without permit affecting adaptability
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of point allocation in skilled worker assessment
Crimes.Court_Ruling: DIO's decision was correct and reasonable under the law
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Religious worker applying under skilled worker category
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: DIO denied points based on regulatory criteria and insufficient evidence
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Challenged denial of points for education, adaptability, and arranged employment
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Evidence deemed insufficient or non-compliant with requirements
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Educational records, employment documentation, work authorization status
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA provisions on skilled worker points and work permit exemptions for religious workers
Crimes.Application_Basis: Permanent residence via skilled worker stream
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Proof of education, valid job offer, legal work authorization
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Overturning of point denial and reassessment of application
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Skilled worker must meet point thresholds; religious workers may work without permit but still require eligibility
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of verified education credentials, absence of permanent job offer, unauthorized work
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: No harm established as decision followed legal standards
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicant failed to meet eligibility criteria due to evidentiary and regulatory shortcomings
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: DIO evaluated available evidence and determined non-compliance
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: Failure to meet skilled worker requirements under IRPA
Crimes.Legal_Provision: IRPA sections on skilled worker assessment and work permits
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Applicant did not satisfy mandatory criteria for point allocation
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Deficiencies in proving education, employment, and lawful work status
